name: David Byrne
description:
'''David Byrne''' ({{IPAc-en|b|Éœr|n}}; born May 14, 1952) is an American musician, writer, visual artist, and filmmaker. He was a founding member and the principal songwriter, lead singer, and guitarist of the [[New wave music|new wave]] band [[Talking Heads]].

Byrne was born in [[Dumbarton]], [[Dunbartonshire]], Scotland, and moved to the US with his family as a child. He co-founded Talking Heads in 1975 in New York City. After releasing eight albums, including seven [[Music recording certification|certified]] gold or platinum, Talking Heads disbanded in 1991. 

Byrne has released solo recordings and worked with media including film, photography, opera, fiction, and non-fiction. He has collaborated with artists including [[Brian Eno]], [[Fatboy Slim]], [[X-Press 2]] and [[St. Vincent (musician)|St. Vincent]]. Byrne has received an [[Academy Award]], a [[Grammy Award]], a [[Special Tony Award]], and a [[Golden Globe Award]], and was inducted to the [[Rock and Roll Hall of Fame]] as part of Talking Heads.
